p: Climate change affects, both positive and negative, water resource availability, agricultural yields, urban healthy living, biodiversity, ecosystems, food security, and public health (Boxall et al. 2009; Godfray et al. 2010; Hitz and Smith 2004; Szwed et al. 2010). The latter includes the extent of spread of vectorborne, waterborne, and airborne infectious diseases (Semenza and Menne 2009).
